title: Top 5 Things to Do with Your Money Right Now
subtitle: Essential financial strategies to enhance your savings, investments, and overall financial health.
content:
Top 5 Things to Do with Your Money Right Now

Here are the top five things that I would do with my money right now as a former financial advisor and portfolio manager. I'm Tyler, and I create financial content for free to help guide your financial decisions.

1. Contribute to Retirement and Health Accounts

I would march directly to HR and ask them to put a percentage of my paycheck towards my 401(k), Roth IRA, and HSA.

2. Maximize Employer Matches

I would ensure that this percentage is high enough to take advantage of every single penny my company might offer as a match on my 401(k) or HSA. Yup, companies match funding for HSAs now!

3. Invest in Low-Cost Index Funds

Within each of these accounts, I would invest in low-cost index funds because I know I cannot beat the market on an annual basis, and if you can, super duper! And yes, you can invest in your health savings account.

4. Obtain Term Life Insurance

If I needed insurance—meaning if I had someone in my life who relied solely on my income for their well-being—I would buy a reasonably priced term life policy. I would also ensure that this person is listed as a beneficiary on my retirement account.

5. Spend on What Brings You Joy

Finally, I would choose the three things in life that bring me the most joy and peace of mind when spending money. I would commit to never skimping on those three things. For me, that's my mental health, physical health, and my bloodhounds.

If any of this information is helpful, please like and follow, and I'll keep sharing insights to help you get one step closer to where you need to be.
